Pre-Game Insights: Slovenia have warned England they will be taking shots from distance because they don’t believe Gareth Southgate’s side will bother to close them down.
The only goal the Three Lions have conceded here in Germany was when Denmark midfielder Morten Hjulmand took aim from 30 yards during last Thursday’s 1-1 draw in Frankfurt.
Much has been made of England’s inability to press opponents, with captain Harry Kane stating they didn’t know who was supposed to go and when.
Slovenian striker Benjamin Sesko and his lethal right boot are ready to exploit England's pressing weakness.
Slovenian midfielder Timi Max Elsnik mentioned that England conceded outside of the box and are not the best at closing down the area 20-25 meters away from goal.
Elsnik also commented on the design of tournament balls, suggesting they are made lighter and faster to produce more spectacular goals.
Elsnik emphasized that Slovenia do not fear England and that a draw should be enough to see them through on three points.
Elsnik stated that Slovenia's mentality is to not be scared of England, similar to their approach against Denmark and Serbia.
